description: WHO declares COVID-19 to be a global pandemic
Governor Whitmer urges people to avoid non-essential travel and gatherings of >100 people
Governor Whitmer closes K-12 schools from March 16 - April 5
Governor Whitmer bans dine-in service at bars and restaurants, and gyms, movie theaters, and recreational venues closed.
First confirmed COVID-19 death in Wayne County
Governor Whitmer issues stay-at-home order barring non-essential in-perosn business, activities, and events through April 13th
Governor Whitmer issues state disaster declaration, and asks lawmakers to extend emergency declaration for 70 days
Governor Whitmer orders K-12 schools closed for the rest of the school year
Governor Whitmer urges residents to wear face masks in public
Governor Whitmer extends state's stay-at-home order until April 30th
Governor Whitmer extends state's stay-at-home-order until May 15th with some restrictions on outdoor activities lifted
Governor Whitmer extends state's stay-at-home-order until May 28th
Governor Whitmer extends state's stay-at-home order, but reopens manufacturing to resume Monday, May 11
